title: R v Spencer
summary: Canadian Supreme Court case balancing privacy rights with investigative powers for digital records.
excerpt: The Court held that subscriber information attracts a reasonable expectation of privacy, limiting warrantless disclosure to law enforcement.

title: Smith v. Maryland
summary: U.S. precedent allowing limited warrantless pen register use during investigations.
excerpt: Individuals assume the risk that the phone company will reveal dialed numbers to the police, diminishing privacy expectations.

title: Tele2 Sverige AB v. Post- och telestyrelsen
summary: CJEU decision on data retention proportionality and safeguards for access to communications metadata.
excerpt: General and indiscriminate retention of data is disproportionate unless accompanied by strict safeguards and judicial oversight.
